publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3837 Alex Fergusson: MV Princess Victoria-That the Parliament notes the commemoration of the 50th Anniversary of the sinking of the MV Princess Victoria, one of the first roll-on roll-off ferries brought into service between Scotland and Ireland after the second world war; remember with great respect the 133 passengers and crew lost on the afternoon of 31 January 1953, and pays tribute to the bravery of the crews of the Royal Navy lifeboats from Portpatrick and Donaghadee and HMS Contest who unsuccessfully attempted to locate the stricken ferry in appalling conditions
S1M-3837 MV Princess Victoria (lodged on 31 January 2003) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3837 MV Princess Victoria (lodged on 31 January 2003) Mr Michael McMahon*
S1M-3837 MV Princess Victoria (lodged on 31 January 2003) David Mundell*, Alasdair Morgan*, Kay Ullrich*
S1M-3837 MV Princess Victoria (lodged on 31 January 2003) Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Linda Fabiani*, Murdo Fraser*
S1M-3837 MV Princess Victoria (lodged on 31 January 2003) Mr Murray Tosh*
S1M-3837 MV Princess Victoria (lodged on 31 January 2003) Mr Jamie Stone*

S1M-3837 Alex Fergusson: MV Princess Victoriaâ€”That the Parliament notes the commemoration of the 50th Anniversary of the sinking of the MV Princess Victoria, one of the first roll-on roll-off ferries brought into service between Scotland and Ireland after the second world war; remember with great respect the 133 passengers and crew lost on the afternoon of 31 January 1953, and pays tribute to the bravery of the crews of the Royal Navy lifeboats from Portpatrick and Donaghadee and HMS Contest who unsuccessfully attempted to locate the stricken ferry in appalling conditions Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Mr Michael McMahon, David Mundell, Alasdair Morgan, Kay Ullrich, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Linda Fabiani, Murdo Fraser, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Jamie Stone
